local.name: Local Storage
local.description: Local storage is a basic stroage type for Backend.AI. This is usually the case when Backend.AI cluster is using the compute node's storage right away.

nfs.name: Network File System
nfs.description: NFS is a distributed file system protocol. NFS is an open standard defined in a Request for Comments (RFC), allowing anyone to implement the protocol.

L3.name: L3 (Lablup LargeData Locator)
L3.description: L3 is a lablup storage environment specialized in interworking between on-premises and cloud environments. It uses CephFS-based cold storage and a dedicated cache to implement a bottleneck-free data exchange in an inter-node environment.

s3.name: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service)
s3.description: Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) is an object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance.

azure.name: Azure FileShare
azure.description: Azure Files offers fully managed file shares in the cloud that are accessible via the industry standard Server Message Block (SMB) protocol.

samba.name: SAMBA storage
samba.description: Samba is a free software re-implementation of the SMB (Server Message Block) networking protocol.

ceph.name: Ceph File System
ceph.description: The Ceph File System, or CephFS, is a POSIX-compliant file system built on top of Cephâ€™s distributed object store, RADOS.

xfs.name: XFS
xfs.description: XFS is a high-performance 64-bit journaling file system created by Silicon Graphics.

weka.name: WekaIO
weka.description: WekaIO is a parallel and scalable file storage system which is optimized for performance and data-intensive workloads.

spectrumscale.name: IBM Spectrum Scale
spectrumscale.description: IBM Spectrum Scale (formerly known as GPFS) is a high-performance, scalable file storage system.

auto.name: Auto
auto.description: Choose the host with the lowest usage from the available host volumes for users. This ensures that usage is evenly distributed across multiple storage volumes, avoiding over-concentration on any single volume.
